meanings.definition: To support or hold up by placing something underneath or against
meanings.sent1: She propped the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He propped the ladder against the wall.
meanings.sent3: The cat propped its paw on the edge of the table, trying to reach for the toy.
meanings.sent4: The tired hiker propped himself against a tree to catch his breath.
meanings.sent5: The old chair was propped up with a stack of books to keep it from wobbling.

meanings.definition: To lean or rest something against a surface for support
meanings.sent1: The painter propped his canvas against the easel.
meanings.sent2: She propped the umbrella against the chair to provide shade.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat propped its head against the cushion and dozed off.
meanings.sent4: The tired traveler propped his backpack against the bench and sat down to rest.
meanings.sent5: The gardener propped the rake against the shed after finishing the yard work.
